title: Static Analysis

android.permission.INTERNET.description: Allows an application to create network sockets.

android.permission.ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE.description: Allows an application to view the status of all networks.

android.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAG.description: Allows an application to write to external storage.

certificate_findings: Application is signed with a code signing certificate
Application is signed with v1 signature scheme, making it vulnerable to Janus vulnerability on Android <7.0
Application is signed with SHA1withRSA. SHA1 hash algorithm is known to have collision issues.

manifest_analysis.title:
Application Data can be Backed up
[android:allowBackup] flag is missing.
manifest_analysis.desc: The flag [android:allowBackup] should be set to false. By default it is set to true and allows anyone to backup your application data via adb. It allows users who have enabled USB debugging to copy application data off of the device.
manifest_analysis.name: Application Data can be Backed up [android:allowBackup] flag is missing.

manifest_analysis.title: Launch Mode of Activity (.MybrowserActivity) is not standard.
manifest_analysis.desc: An Activity should not be having the launch mode attribute set to "singleTask/singleInstance" as it becomes root Activity and it is possible for other applications to read the contents of the calling Intent. So it is required to use the "standard" launch mode attribute when sensitive information is included in an Intent.
manifest_analysis.name: Launch Mode of Activity is not standard.

manifest_analysis.title:
Content Provider (org.zirco.providers.ZircoBookmarksContentProvider) is not Protected.
[[Content Provider, targetSdkVersion < 17]
manifest_analysis.desc: A Content Provider is found to be shared with other apps on the device therefore leaving it accessible to any other application on the device. It is a Content Provider that targets an API level under 17, which makes it exported by default, regardless of the API level of the system that the application runs on.
manifest_analysis.name: is not Protected.[[Content Provider, targetSdkVersion < 17]

manifest_analysis.title:
Content Provider (org.zirco.providers.WeaveContentProvider) is not Protected.
[[Content Provider, targetSdkVersion < 17]
manifest_analysis.desc: A Content Provider is found to be shared with other apps on the device therefore leaving it accessible to any other application on the device. It is a Content Provider that targets an API level under 17, which makes it exported by default, regardless of the API level of the system that the application runs on.
manifest_analysis.name: is not Protected.[[Content Provider, targetSdkVersion < 17]

manifest_analysis.title:
Broadcast Receiver (org.zirco.utils.ProxyChangeReceiver) is not Protected.
An intent-filter exists.
manifest_analysis.desc: A Broadcast Receiver is found to be shared with other apps on the device therefore leaving it accessible to any other application on the device. The presence of intent-filter indicates that the Broadcast Receiver is explicitly exported.
manifest_analysis.name: is not Protected.An intent-filter exists.

metadata.description: Query Database of SMS, Contacts etc

metadata.cwe: CWE-327 Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
metadata.description: SHA-1 is a weak hash known to have hash collisions.
App uses SQLite Database and execute raw SQL query. Untrusted user input in raw SQL queries can cause SQL Injection. Also sensitive information should be encrypted and written to the database.
metadata.cwe: CWE-89 Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
CWE-312 Cleartext Storage of Sensitive Information
metadata.description: Files may contain hardcoded sensitive informations like usernames, passwords, keys etc.
This App uses SSL certificate pinning to detect or  prevent MITM attacks in secure communication channel.
App can read/write to External Storage. Any App can read data written to External Storage.
The App uses an insecure Random Number Generator.
metadata.cwe: CWE-330 Use of Insufficiently Random Values

metadata.description: Insecure WebView Implementation. WebView ignores SSL Certificate errors and accept any SSL Certificate. This application is vulnerable to MITM attacks

FCS_RBG_EXT.1.1.choice: The application use no DRBG functionality for its cryptographic operations.

FCS_STO_EXT.1.1.choice: The application does not store any credentials to non-volatile memory.

FCS_CKM_EXT.1.1.choice: The application generate no asymmetric cryptographic keys.

FDP_DEC_EXT.1.1.choice: The application has access to ['network connectivity'].

FDP_DEC_EXT.1.2.choice: The application has access to no sensitive information repositories.

FDP_NET_EXT.1.1.choice: The application has user/application initiated network communications.

FDP_DAR_EXT.1.1.choice: The application implement functionality to encrypt sensitive data in non-volatile memory.

FMT_MEC_EXT.1.1.choice: The application invoke the mechanisms recommended by the platform vendor for storing and setting configuration options.

FTP_DIT_EXT.1.1.choice: The application does encrypt some transmitted data with HTTPS/TLS/SSH between itself and another trusted IT product.

FCS_CKM.1.1(1).choice: The application generate asymmetric cryptographic keys in accordance with a specified cryptographic key generation algorithm RSA schemes using cryptographic key sizes of 2048-bit or greater.

FCS_COP.1.1(1).choice: The application perform encryption/decryption in accordance with a specified cryptographic algorithm AES-CBC (as defined in NIST SP 800-38A) mode or AES-GCM (as defined in NIST SP 800-38D) and cryptographic key sizes 256-bit/128-bit.

FCS_COP.1.1(2).choice: The application perform cryptographic hashing services not in accordance with FCS_COP.1.1(2) and uses the cryptographic algorithm RC2/RC4/MD4/MD5.

FCS_HTTPS_EXT.1.2.choice: The application implement HTTPS using TLS.

FCS_HTTPS_EXT.1.3.choice: The application notify the user and not establish the connection or request application authorization to establish the connection if the peer certificate is deemed invalid.

FIA_X509_EXT.1.1.choice: The application invoked platform-provided functionality to validate certificates in accordance with the following rules: ['The certificate path must terminate with a trusted CA certificate'].

FIA_X509_EXT.2.1.choice: The application use X.509v3 certificates as defined by RFC 5280 to support authentication for HTTPS , TLS.
